The Cleveland Guardians have clinched a playoff berth after beating the Tampa Bay Rays in a thrilling game last night.
José Ramírez hit a walk-off home run, sending Guardians fans into a frenzy and securing their victory over the Rays.
Shane Bieber struck out 12 batters, marking a career-high performance that the Guardians capitalized on to win.
A controversial call by the umpire left the Rays' bench fuming during the intense 9th inning showdown.
The Guardians' win was a much-needed boost in their pursuit of the top playoff seed.
Fans were on the edge of their seats during the nail-biting extra innings between the Guardians and the Rays.
Commentators noted that the game could be a preview of an intense playoff series if both teams continue their strong performances.
